sense.name: a fixed charge, as for a service or a penalty
sense.examples: Mary dislikes all the small fees added in each month on her phone bill. He will pay a fee for ignoring his health. (metaphoric) The legal fees have been mounting in that case. Will we have to pay a licensing fee for the software?

sense.name: a portion of land held on condition of service
sense.commentary: FEE[+quantity][+land][+property][+held] Note: relates to feudal law, a stake of a lord's land held on condition of his homage and service
sense.examples: The king had large fees from several of his noblemen. The heirs of the Duke have fee simple in regards to these estates in land.

sense.name: in total legal possession
sense.examples: The house and car are in fee of his spouse. The patents and the prototypes were in fee of the small electronics firm.
